description: Demolition of existing buildings and construction of a part two and part three storey building including excavation for basement level to accommodate 8no. self-contained flats; provision of 3no. car parking spaces within forecourt; provision of refuse and bicycle store and associated landscaping
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings and documents: HA34168_P01_E (Location Plan), HA34168_P02_E (Topographical Survey), HA34168_P03_E (As Existing Floor Plans - Ground Floor and Basement), HA34168_P04_E (As Existing  Floor Plans - First and Second Floor), HA34168_P05_E (As Existing Elevations), HA34168_P06_E (As Existing Sections), HA34168_P07_E (Site Constraints), HA34168_P08_E (Site Constraints - Contextual), HA34168_P09_K (Development Site 1 - Proposed Site Plan), HA34168_P11_J (Proposed Ground Floor), HA34168_P12_G (Proposed Lower Ground Floor), HA34168_P13_G (Proposed First Floor), HA34168_P14_G (Proposed Second Floor), HA34168_P15_J (Proposed Front Elevation), HA34168_P16_J (Proposed Rear Elevation), HA34168_P17_J (Proposed Side Elevations), HA34168_P18 (Disabled Bay Vehicle Tracking), HA34168_P20_H (Concept Images), HA34168_P21_G (Contextual Visual Images), Design & Access Statement produced by Berrys and dated March 2020, Heritage Statement produced by Berrys and dated March 2020, 10 & 12 Perryn Road Ealing Ecological Assessment Revision 01 (produced by Turnstone Ecology and dated May 2020), Daylight Sunlight & Overshadowing Report produced by Syntegra Consulting (dated May 2020
with ref: 19-5880) and Tree Survey and Aboricultural Impact Assessment produced by Syntegra Consulting (dated July 2019 with ref: 19-5880 Rev B).

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, details of all external materials to be used in the development shall be submitted to and  approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of works (except demolition and ground works). The details shall be fully implemented as approved.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| The proposed rooflights to the roof slopes of the hereby approved building shall be Conservation style rooflights and lie flush with the roof.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, and to safeguard the character and appearance of the conservation area in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016) and policies 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| No operations (including initial site clearance) shall commence on site in connection with the development hereby approved until a suitable scheme (Arboricultural Method Statement) for the protection of existing trees (incl. street trees) and hedgerows, aside from those identified for removal in plan HA34168_P09_K, has been submitted and its installation on site has been approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

All protection measures must fully detail each phase of the development process taking into account demolition/site clearance works, all construction works and hard and soft landscaping works. Details shall include the following:

a. A full survey of all trees on site and those within influencing distance on adjacent sites and the street in accordance with BS5837*, with tree works proposals. All trees must be plotted on a site plan**, clearly and accurately depicting trunk locations, root protection areas and canopy spreads.
b. A plan** detailing all trees and hedgerows planned for retention and removal.
c. A schedule of tree works for all the retained trees specifying pruning and other remedial or preventative work, whether for physiological,
hazard abatement, aesthetic or operational reasons. All tree works shall be carried out in accordance with BS 3998.
d. Soil assessments/survey
e. Timing and phasing of works
f. Site specific demolition and hard surface removal specifications
g. Site specific construction specifications (e.g. in connection with
foundations, bridging, water features, surfacing)
h. Access arrangements and car parking
i. Level changes
j Landscaping proposals
k. A Tree protection plan** in accordance with BS5837* detailing all methods of protection, including but not restricted to: locations of
construction exclusion zones, root protection areas, fit for purpose fencing and ground protection, service routes, works access space,
material/machinery/waste storage and permanent & temporary hard surfaces.
l. Soil remediation plans, where unauthorised access has damaged root protection areas in the construction exclusion zones.
m. Details of the arboricultural supervision schedule.

All tree protection methods detailed in the approved Arboricultural Method Statement shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works including external works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the site, unless the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority has first been sought and
obtained.
*Using the most recent revision the of the Standard
** Plans must be of a minimum scale of 1:200 (unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority)

Reason: To ensure appropriate tree protection in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with policies 5.10 and 7.21 of the London Plan, policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines.

| No operations shall commence on site (except for demolition and ground works), in connection with the development hereby approved, until a suitable scheme of proposed tree planting and tree pits have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The scheme shall include the following comprehensive details of all trees to be planted:
a. Full planting specification - tree size, species, the numbers of trees and any changes from the original application proposals.
b. Locations of all proposed species.
c. Comprehensive details of ground/tree pit preparation to include:
d. Plans detailing adequate soil volume provision to allow the tree to grow to maturity
e. Engineering solutions to demonstrate the tree will not interfere with structures (e.g. root barriers/deflectors) in the future
f. Staking/tying method(s).
g. Five year post planting maintenance and inspection schedule.

All tree planting must be carried out in full accordance with the approved scheme in the nearest planting season (1st October to 28th February inclusive). The quality of all approved tree planting should be carried out to the levels detailed in British Standard 8545, Trees: from nursery to independence in the landscape - Recommendations.

Reason: To ensure appropriate tree protection in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with policies 5.10 and 7.21 of the London Plan, policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines. | Notwithstanding the information shown on the approved plans, details of the hard and soft landscaping, planting and boundary treatments shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development, except for demolition and ground works. All detailed works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of the premises and permanently retained thereafter. Details shall include:
a. Materials and height of the boundary treatment;
b. Provision of planting by species and size at the time of planting;
c. Provision of off-street parking spaces and their demarcation;
d. The defined points of access and any new surfacing materials to be used;
e. A landscaping and plant maintenance plan; and
f. The privacy screens to all side-facing aspects of terraces/balconies at first floor level and above (incl. height, materials and siting).

Reason: To improve the visual amenity of the property through urban greening, to ensure the proposed planting and materials harmonise with the historic setting and to protect the privacy and amenities of occupiers of the development and surrounding properties in accordance with policies 3.5, 5.10, 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016) and policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Any planting that is part of the approved scheme that within a period of five years after planting is removed, dies or becomes seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced in the next planting season and all planting shall be replaced with others of a similar size and species and in the same position, unless the Local Planning Authority first gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: To improve the visual amenity of the property through urban greening and to ensure that the off-street parking does not prejudice pedestrian safety and in the interests of providing a sustainable environment for future occupiers of the development in accordance with policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policies 6.3, 6.9, 6.11, 6.13, 7.4, 7.5 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016); The London Environment Strategy (2018); and policies 5.10, 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| he vehicle parking arrangements of the approved scheme shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available and shall not be used for any other purpose. No additional car parking shall be formed or made available except with the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To improve the visual amenity of the property through urban greening and to ensure that the off-street parking does not prejudice pedestrian safety and in the interests of providing a sustainable environment for future occupiers of the development in accordance with policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policies 6.3, 6.9, 6.11, 6.13, 7.4, 7.5 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016); The London Environment Strategy (2018); and policies 5.10, 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved, a demolition method statement and construction management plan shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing. Details shall include control measures for:
a. noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
b. dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
c. lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
d. hours of work and all associated activities, including deliveries, collections etc. restricted to:
i. 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays and 0800 -1300 Saturdays for noisy work audible beyond the site boundary,
ii. 1800-2100 Monday to Friday and 1300-2100 Saturday for works which will not give rise to disturbance (e.g. cosmetic work, plastering,
painting, electrical fitting, plumbing, brick laying, etc. and excluding any works which require the use of power tools, machinery or work on a party wall or in close proximity to neighbours),
iii. no work on Sundays,
iv. all unnecessary noise and disturbance such as noise from raised voices, radios, car parking etc. avoided at all times.
e. daily toolbox briefings shall include noise disturbance discussions and clear directions to site workers, with specific instructions on when the use of power tools and other machinery should cease
f. neighbour liaison and notifications to interested parties shall be conducted by letter drops, email and phone, and
g. public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with policies 5.3 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016) and policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Prior to commencement of the development, except for demolition of ground works, clear layout plans and details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing of an enhanced sound insulation value of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings, e.g. kitchen/ living/ dining/ bathroom above/below/adjoining bedroom of separate dwelling. The assessment and mitigation measures shall be based on standards of the Council's SPG10 and the criteria of BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and
permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016) and Standard 30 of the Housing SPG. | A minimum of thirteen (13) cycle storage spaces shall be provided on site in accordance with the location identified within the drawings and documents listed under condition 2. The cycle storage area shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan 2016 and Supplementary Planning Guidance (Housing) (2012). | Prior to the occupation of the development, a refuse store with the location identified within drawings listed under condition 2 shall be provided. The refuse store shall have a minimum capacity of 760L refuse bins and 760L recycling bins and shall be permanently retained for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To provide waste storage facilities, in accordance with policy 5.17 of the London Plan (2016) and SPG4 Refuse and Recycling Facilities. | All windows and rooflights to the north and south elevations at first floor level and above of the building shall contain only obscure glass and only have top openings at a minimum of 1.7m from floor level.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties in accordance with policies 7.4, 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), policies Local variation to policy 7.4 and 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1, 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012).
